intro: Greigia collina, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and has a woody stem with alternate, palmately lobed leaves. Its flowers bloom in summer and are pollinated by insects, contributing to its ecological role in its native habitat. Greigia collina is also valued for its ornamental qualities in horticulture.
